After a furious moment or two, he suddenly stops, d the poker, and stares at the body in horrified disbelief. St. Luc slowly backs away from the man's body, which is v still and quietly oozes blood on to the damp concrete flo He bumps into the edge of the door left open by the man. collision seems to startle him out of his daze somewhat, he turns, himself scratched and bleeding, and staggers up the basement steps.

Forsythe waits impatiently for St. Luc. Mr. Spergazzi is  watching a variety show on TV and Mrs. Spergazzi is makin ravioli in the kitchen, more or less recovered from her  encounter with the parasite. Suddenly a piercing scream is heard from down the hall. M Spergazzi, hard of hearing, doesn't notice. The scream is followed by bangs, crashes, and insane laughter and giggl Mrs. Spergazzi comes out of the kitchen. She has heard th noises. She and Forsythe look at each other for a moment, then Forsythe goes to the door and slides the chain lock  into place. She then goes to the telephone to call the po
(into receiver) Hello? Hello?

She dials a few times, and clicks the receiver button.  Nothing. The phone is dead. She puts the receiver back on the hook. Mrs. Spergazzi knows that something is very wro She wrings her hands and begins to wail in Italian.

In the hallway outside the Spergazzi apartment, a group o giggling, drooling residents stand around a door. One of these residents is the superintendent, who is open the door with one of his set of master keys. The resident some of them women, giggle in anticipation. Once the door has been opened, they all rush in, drooling and moaning. From inside the apartment we hear several muffled voices, first angry and indignant, then pleading and terrified.  Screams and crashes follow.

Mrs. Spergazzi is getting hysterical; Mr. Spergazzi is tr to calm her down by getting her to sit in front of the TV set with him. But each time he pushes her down, she pops and begins wailing and moaning again. Forsythe paces back and forth, checks her watch, paces so more. Finally, after a particularly noisy outburst by Mrs Spergazzi, Forsythe picks up the doctor's bag, unchains t door, and leaves. Spergazzi hears the door slam and looks up.
Miss! Nurse! Come back! Cabiria, she  needs something...!
He lapses back into Italian, trying vainly to calm his wi down.
Betts and Janine are on the sofa, Janine with her head in Betts's lap, Betts rocking Janine like a child.
(sobbing) Oh, Betts, Betts, everything is so  hideous. Everything dies and rots  and disappears. I'm going to die,  and you're going to die, and Nick...
She breaks down. Betts is drowsy-eyed and smiling. She strokes Janine's ha

There, there, there. It all gets  sorted out in the genes and  chromosomes. It's not for us to think  about at all. It's not our problem  at all, 'Nine. We're just here to  exist and to have a good time. Exist  and have a good time. (pause) Do I feel good, 'Nine? Do I feel  good to you?
Janine's eyes are red and she still sobs a bit as she spe but she is obviously feeling a bit soothed.
Oh, you feel very good, Betts. You  have such a cosy body. I'm jealous,  I'm so skinny.
(casually, as though  it were the most  ordinary request in  the world) Make love to me, 'Nine? I want you  to make love to me. Please, please  make love to me.
Janine twists around and looks up at Betts. There is some in Betts' tone -- quite apart from what she is saying --  that disturbs her, something that reminds her of her husb
Betts! You can't really be saying  that! You just can't!

Betts smiles drowsily. She bends over Janine, turning her head in her hands until they face each other. Betts lower her face toward Janine. Janine is wide-eyed, almost hypno by Betts's strength, smile, and confidence.
Let's not talk any more, 'Nine, shall  we? Let's kiss and make up. Let's  kiss... kiss and make up, shall we?  'Nine?

Janine resists only slightly as Betts places her lips on  Janine's. After a pause, Betts suddenly opens her mouth w and presses her lips savagely against Janine's. She holds Janine's head firmly as they kiss. Janine strug for a moment, then opens her mouth as well. Her eyes are closed in passion, then suddenly open wide i terror as Betts's throat swells like a goiter as a parasi rushes up her throat toward Janine's open mouth. The para begins to force its way into Janine's mouth and down her  throat. Janine gags and tries to pull away, but too late.
Forsythe runs down the steps which lead to the incinerato and pulls open the steel door at the bottom. She begins t look around for St. Luc.
Roger? Roger, are you here?

She suddenly stumbles across the body of the man St. Luc killed. She actually has to break her fall with her hands which slip in the man's blood. Horrified, she gets up and backs away. The sounds of people moaning and laughing are coming from everywhere. Forsythe finds herself up against a large doo She tugs on the handle and it opens.

St. Luc has made his way to the main doors and stands tal to the rental agent, Merrick, who is leaning against the  intercom board with the doorman's pocketbook romance in o hand. The agent looks perfectly normal, though he keeps wiping mouth unobtrusively with the back of his hand.
...haven't seen anything that looks  like trouble at all. Just filling in  for Walter... the doorman. But if  you want me to call the police, I  will.
St. Luc is cautious but he seems to believe Merrick. He  presses the button which buzzes the Spergazzi apartment.  Nobody answers. A middle-aged man walks in. Worried, St. buzzes again.
Apartment 307? Visiting my sister.
Merrick smiles and opens the door for the man, who goes i and takes the stairway up, preferring to walk. The intercom squawks and Spergazzi answers the buzzer.
Yes? Who is there?
It's Dr. St. Luc, Mr Spergazzi. Let  me speak to the nurse, please.
Oh, but the nurse, she went away. I  think she must go to look for you.

St. Luc curses under his breath and makes a move toward t door. Merrick smiles and pulls it open for him. St. Luc  disappears down the stairs leading to the incinerator. As the stairway doors close, the elevators slide open and young couple come out heading for the main doors, dressed go out to a late party. Before they reach the doors, Merrick slips through them a meets the couple in the lobby. He smiles broadly as he  approaches them.
Evening, Mr. Wolf, Miss Lewis. I  wonder if I could talk to you for a  second in my office?
Why don't you do something about all  that noise? We like parties, but  this is ridiculous.
Well, there may be a connection.  See, it's about your locker. 'Fraid  somebody busted into it tonight.
(together) Oh, no! What a drag!
'Fraid so. I've got a few of the  things they threw around in my office  and if you could identify it...
The couple turn, grumbling, and walk toward Merrick's off Merrick follows, wiping his mouth with the back of his ha

The young couple enter the rental office, Merrick followi close behind. Once they are all in, Merrick closes the do He rests against the door and drools copiously, then gigg The young couple turn to look at him. Suddenly, three mor residents, two women and a man, all of them half naked, j down on them from the tops of large filing cabinets. The  residents begin to kiss and paw the couple. Merrick wipes his mouth with the back of his hand and then throws himse on top of the writhing mass.

Finding herself in the underground garage, Forsythe decid to get in her car and drive out. She finds her car -- a D or Toyota -- gets in, throws the doctor's bag in the back and drives up the ramp leading to the sliding garage door The car rolls over the cable which normally activates the doors, but nothing happens. Forsythe puts the car in reve and backs over the cable, but still nothing happens. She  sits with the car idling, trying to figure out what to do next. Suddenly the driver's door of her car is yanked open and doorman, slavering and drooling, throws himself at her. The doorman forces her down across the front seats of the car and begins to kiss her on the neck and rip her clothe to shreds. He gradually forces himself between her legs.

St. Luc bounds down the incinerator room stairs looking f Forsythe. He sees immediately that she is not there, but  also notices handprints in blood on the door leading to t garage. He opens the garage door. Forsythe's screams come echoing through the garage.

St. Luc races through the garage, trying to find Forsythe He finally sees her car in the middle of the exit ramp an runs over to it. The doorman is still on top of Forsythe in the front seat the car. St. Luc pulls the doorman's gun out of its holst and begins smashing away at the doorman with it. The doorman pounds St. Luc in the temple with his fist an lifts himself partially off Forsythe, half turning toward St. Luc, who is staggered by the blow. The doorman's face is covered with blood and drool. Repul and terrified, St. Luc fires the gun into the doorman's u body three times, heedless of the possibility that he mig hit Forsythe. The doorman slumps over Forsythe. St. Luc grips the gun and staggers over to the car. He pu the doorman off Forsythe, who is completely soaked with b She has obviously had an externally rough time, but there nothing to suggest that she has been infected by the door St. Luc shoves her over into the passenger's seat, where slumps, dazed. He doesn't have to start the car -- it's n been turned off. He slams the shift lever into reverse an backs up, peeling rubber, to the base of the ramp. He put it into first and begins to accelerate, foot to the floor toward the garage door. Another car full of residents suddenly careens in front o the door and screeches to a halt, blocking St. Luc, who i swerving to avoid them smashes his fender into a concrete post. He picks up the gun from the console between the se and, opening the car door, empties the gun at the residen who are emerging from their car. One of the residents falls back into the car, blocking th other two. St. Luc drags Forsythe out of the car, throws her over hi shoulder, and carries her down the ramp toward the door  leading to the incinerator.

St. Luc half drags, half carries Forsythe along hallways  whose doors are wide open. From the apartments issues the entire catalogue of suggestive sexual sounds -- giggles,  moans, groans, cries, whispers, shrieks. We catch glimpses of people of all kinds and ages locked  together on floors, chairs, etc. St. Luc finds an open ex door and plunges through it, taking Forsythe with him.

The door to the gym opens and St. Luc looks in cautiously The gym is quite tiny and is deserted. St. Luc pulls Fors in and closes the door. He lays Forsythe down on a gym ma and then barricades the door with a box horse and a weigh lifting table. He kneels beside Forsythe, who seems to be only just rega consciousness. St. Luc strokes her face, pushes strands o hair matted with blood out of her eyes.
(more to himself than  Forsythe) Rollo'll be here soon. Rollo'll be  here soon.

Rollo's car pulls up to the main doors and parks in a  blatantly illegal space. He flips up a card on the dash w says 'M.D. ON CALL,' then gets out of the car. He walks up the steps and through the main doors, which a wide open. Nobody is in sight.

Rollo walks along the hallway, bag in hand, envelope unde arm. He stops in front of Tudor's door, checks the number against the number written in his notebook, then knocks o the door. Nobody answers. He knocks once more, then looks around  shiftily before turning the knob and walking right in.
Rollo enters and closes the door behind him, deliberately slamming it. He walks into the center of the living room bellows.
Hello, good evening, is anybody here?  Dr. St. Luc? It's Dr. Linsky here to  see you for consultation.
Still no answer. Rollo is puzzled. He snoops around the  apartment until he finds the bedroom with its door half  closed. He pushes gently on the door and opens it gradual
It's Dr. Linsky. Anybody home?
Rollo can now see the figure of Tudor lying in bed in the dim light of the bedroom. Rollo enters the bedroom.
Is that Mr. Nicholas Tudor? It's Dr.  Linsky. I'm meeting Dr. St. Luc here.  He must be a little bit late.
Tudor does not answer, does not move. He lies stiffly on bed on his back, mouth insanely agape, eyes shut, covers  half on the floor.
Is anyone here? Nicholas Tudor? Is  that you? Tudor? Mind if I have a  look at you?
He stands at the edge of the bed, peering at Tudor, looki for signs of consciousness. After a pause, he kneels on t bed and slowly draws back the covers.
Just a peek, OK? A little peek won't  hurt.

Tudor's abdomen is gradually exposed as the covers are dr back. Crouched in the shadows is one of the freshly emerg blood parasites, which sits poised for only a fraction of second before it springs at Rollo's face with great energ As the thing hits Rollo's face it locks on to his head by entangling its stubby tentacles in his hair and attaching its suckers to his cheeks and chin. Rollo tries to stand, then staggers and falls. The thing  tries to force its way into Rollo's mouth, cutting his li in the process. They bleed furiously. When Rollo manages pull a sucker away, a piece of his flesh comes with it. As he writhes on the carpeted floor, two more parasites a crawling toward him from under the bed, covered with dust from the floor. They clamber on to him and fasten on to h face, suckering on to his ears, his throat, forehead, eye One of them begins to ooze corrosive fluid on to his face Rollo screams in pain. He manages to roll to his feet. He staggers out of the  darkness of the bedroom into the living room, one arm  extended, groping like a blind man, the three parasites s locked on to his face. They try to pull his lips apart, b he keeps his teeth firmly clenched to keep them from forc their way into the depths of his body. He takes a few unbalanced steps toward the kitchen. With sudden spasm of pain, he hurls himself sideways into the  kitchen and almost falls again, grabbing at the last mome on to the sink. His hands touch a large pair of pliers, a screwdriver, an hammer on the counter by the sink, left there by Tudor we ago. Rollo seizes the pliers and begins to pull the paras from his face with their steel jaws. The parasites, swoll with Tudor's blood, burst and spurt as the pliers tear th apart. In the bedroom, Tudor's eyes snap open. His head rises fr the pillow. He swings his legs over the side of the bed and, ashen an gaunt, shakes his head slowly as though waking from a dre He begins to mumble.
No, no, no, no. Mustn't, mustn't.  You mustn't kill them, no, no, no.

Then, as though listening to himself and suddenly  understanding what he is saying, he rises to his feet sha and walks to the kitchen. He stops at the kitchen door. Rollo has torn the parasites from his face and is poundin away at them in the kitchen sink. The parasites wriggle a curl in their own blood in the sink as he smashes away at them with the pliers. Tudor staggers toward Rollo.
No, no. You mustn't kill them. That's  my blood you're spilling! My blood!  Let them come home, let them come  home, home, home inside me. Don't  kill them...!
He starts to paw Rollo, feebly trying to prevent him from further mutilating the parasites. He reaches over St. Luc shoulder and grabs a large chunk of one of the parasites.
(whining pitifully) At least save me one! For God's sake!  At least save me one. One, one, one,  one...

Rollo turns as Tudor begins to shove the piece of flesh b down his throat. As Rollo turns we see that bits of tentacles and suckers still attached to his cheeks, throat, forehead. His face melting and smoking in areas where it has been burned by corrosive fluid on one side. He stares in rage at Tudor. With a scream, Rollo strikes Tudor with the pliers. Tudor falls, hitting his head on various chairs and protruding  corners as he goes down, the chunk of parasite still in h mouth as he finally comes to rest, twitching, on the floo Rollo drops the pliers on the floor. He stares at Tudor in shock. His face is reflected in a c frying pan hanging over the stove. Noticing the reflectio Rollo leans over to get close to his own horrible image. gingerly touches his face, inspecting the damage, shiveri and moaning. Still shaking, he turns to leave. Without warning, Tudor leaps up at Rollo with insane ener and bowls him over, pliers in hand. Sitting on Rollo's ch Tudor smashes away at Rollo's face and head with the plie the piece of dead parasite in his mouth dropping on to Ro face as he drools.
Forsythe finally opens her eyes. She smiles at St. Luc, w hovers anxiously over her as she lies on the gym mat.
Can you walk? I couldn't find anything  wrong with you.
Forsythe nods and manages to sit up with St. Luc's help.  Once she seems able to stay propped up without St. Luc's  help, he gets up and begins to move the barricade away fr the door.
Rollo and the police should be here  by now. It's just a question of  avoiding infected residents until we  find them.
St. Luc comes back to Forsythe and kneels beside her.
OK? Ready to go?
Forsythe puts her arm around St. Luc's neck as though wan support. Instead, she draws him down toward her and begin to babble in a strange, casual, dreamy way.

Sometimes I have a recurrent dream.  Have I ever told you about it,  darling? I guess you could call it a  Freudian dream, because in this dream  I find myself making love to Sigmund  Freud. But I'm having trouble because  he's old and dying, and he smells  bad and I find him repulsive. And  then he tells me that everything is  erotic, everything is sexual, you  know what I mean? He has a very thick  accent, but I can understand him  perfectly. He tells me that even old  flesh is erotic flesh, that disease  is the love of two alien kinds of  creatures for each other, that dying  is an act of eroticism, that even  chemicals combine out of sexual frenzy  and longing. That breathing is sexual,  that talking is sexual, that just to  physically exist is sexual... And I  believe him, and we make love  beautifully...

While she talks, Forsythe gradually slips her arms around St. Luc's neck and brings her lips closer and closer to h St. Luc, mesmerized by the hypnotic drone of her words, i about to kiss her. Suddenly her mouth snaps open wide wit mechanical precision, her head tilts back, her eyes flick closed. St. Luc stares at her in horror as her throat begins to s In the depths of Forsythe's mouth two parasite tentacles  probe about, seeking a firm hold for their suckers so tha they can pull the parasite's body out of her narrow esoph St. Luc hesitates only for an instant, then rips a strip  from her blouse, balls it up, and shoves it into her mout Holding her while she struggles to remove it, he rips off second strip and ties it around her head to keep the gag St. Luc rises, throws Forsythe over his shoulder and begi to step toward the door of the gym. Dangling over St. Luc's shoulder, Forsythe struggles, moa and howls as best she can. St. Luc manages to pin her han to her sides so that she can't pull the gag out. Before St. Luc reaches the door, a handsome middle-aged w peeks in around the corner.
(crooning in reply to  Forsythe's howl) Hellooooo? Oooooo? Is there anyone  here who's all alooooooooone?
St. Luc rushes at the woman, knocking her over. She rolls the floor, hugging herself and crooning. Once out the door, St. Luc makes for the nearest exit.

As St. Luc begins to ascend the stairs, we can see tiny b hooks tearing through Forsythe's gag. Blood begins to soa through from the inside. A group of residents suddenly appear at the next landing  above St. Luc and, noticing them, begin to walk down the  steps, moaning and crooning and making vaguely sexual ges toward the pair. Blood is now pouring from Forsythe's mouth and tentacles groping for leverage at her cheeks and chin. St. Luc decides to attempt to shoulder his way up the sta certain that Rollo and the police must be at the main doo As he hits the residents on the stairs, they try to kiss  him, caress him, pull his clothes off. They finally manag to drag Forsythe from his shoulders, almost unbalancing h as they do so. St. Luc tries to prop her up on her feet, she's completely limp. St. Luc holds Forsythe against the stairway wall as residents mill all about them. He looks her in sudden hopelessness.
(shouting) Forsythe! Forsythe!

The parasite is now half out of her mouth, hanging throug the slit it has torn in her gag. St. Luc lets go of Forsythe and she sinks to the floor. T residents are swarming all over them. St. Luc abandons  Forsythe and begins to fight his way up the stairs. He runs higher and higher, up flight after flight of stai until he is free of the slow-moving residents. He leans b against a wall, panting. Crooning and moaning echo up to him from below. He leans  over the railing and looks down. In the stairwell several flights below, Forsythe lies  surrounded by milling residents, legs spread as though ab to give birth. A resident leans over and pulls the parasi from her mouth, then swallows it whole with gusto. Other  residents touch her, stroke her, caress her, as though  offering her a strange kind of comfort. St. Luc reels with disgust and disbelief. He turns and ru

Between the two towers lies the swimming pool. St. Luc ma to reach the door leading from the South Tower into the p He hangs on to the door of the pool itself for a moment i near exhaustion, then opens it and enters. The pool is dim and tranquil. Two women are swimming in t deep end as though nothing were at all abnormal. St. Luc watches them for a moment, enjoying the apparent  normalcy of the scene. Then he staggers forward, calling to the swimmers.
Have you seen the police? I'm Dr.  St. Luc. Have you seen the police?  Have they come?

The swimmers both flick playfully beneath the water's sur St. Luc approaches the water's edge, waiting for them to  surface. The water ripples and bubbles near his feet. A  sinking feeling comes over him. He watches in horrible  fascination. He begins to shiver. The ripples and bubbles spread and intensify. After a pau Janine surfaces, smiling radiantly. A few seconds later,  Betts surfaces near her, the very picture of benign, wate calm. Betts gestures to St. Luc to join them in the pool. St. Luc shakes his head slowly, backing away from the poo He turns to leave the room. As he turns, Mr. Spergazzi ap out of the shadows behind him. Using his four-pronged alu cane, he pushes St. Luc backwards into the pool, chucklin playfully. Spergazzi looks around for approval as St. Luc begins to  thrash about wildly. Betts swims up beside St. Luc, grabs him, and holds him u
(to Janine) A kiss! (laughter echoes in  the pool room) Give him a kiss. Give him a kiss.
(voices echoing in  unison) A kiss, a kiss, a kiss!

Betts allows St. Luc to rise to the surface as a laughing Janine splashes over to him and fastens her mouth to his. As they kiss, Janine's hands hold St. Luc's head fiercely Betts assists her by pinning St. Luc's arms behind him.  Janine's throat ripples and swells, her cheeks billow as parasite swarms upwards from deep within her body. St. Lu cheeks now swell as the parasite enters his mouth. His ey jolt open in terror and he manages to pull away slightly, revealing the tentacles joining her mouth to his like  grappling irons. St. Luc twists out of Betts' grasp. He and Janine, still  locked together, sink beneath the surface. Dozens of residents pour into the pool room and join Sper and the others at the poolside. Among these are faces alr familiar to us: Kurt, Kresimir and Benda, the old laundry room woman, etc. The new spectators clap, laugh, croon, and moan as though witnessing a wild group baptism. Some of them throw thems into the water, pulling others in with them. Deep under the water's surface, St. Luc still struggles t free himself from Janine. Residents now splash into the d all around them. St. Luc's cheeks bulge wide and blood dribbles from his n and mouth. His throat swells monstrously. Janine releases him just in time for us to see the end of a tentacle slip back into his mouth. He exhales heavily as parasite enzym pump furiously through his body. The water boils with his exhaled breath. Janine and St. Luc drift apart, now completely calm, as  residents splash and swim, kick and embrace.

The vast and dimly lit garage is full of silent cars.  Somewhere an engine starts up, then another and another,  until the whole garage is full of fumes and the revving o engines. As we prowl amongst the cars we find many of the resident we already know, now dressed to the teeth in their seduct best. Mr. Spergazzi and his wife stand and watch the spectacle, canes in hand, with great dignity. With them stand others who are too old or too young to go into the night looking for new hosts for their parasites, content to remain  incubators for the time being. The residents are full of bubbly anticipation in their ca Kresimir leans out of his car and shouts to no one in  particular.
(shouting) Nobody should be alone! Nobody should  be alone tonight!
The rest of the residents pick up the cry and chant toget
(together) Nobody alone! Nobody alone!
The night watchman stands near the garage doors. Smiling  broadly, he stamps on the cable which activates the slidi doors.

The garage doors slide open. One car surges up the ramp a of all the others, stopping at the top. The driver of this first car is St. Luc, sleek and exuber a raised collar and a scarf hiding most of his scars. He  glances into his rear-view mirror. In the rear-view mirror, St. Luc sees all the other cars  lining up behind him, lights blazing. St. Luc smiles, then steps on the accelerator. His car sh out into the street. As St. Luc's car turns on to the street, car after car fo him. We rise higher and higher above the Starliner Towers apartment complex until the cars are a small stream of li far below, bleeding into the main body of the neon-lit  metropolis.
